data.title: Popular Party of Andalusia
data.text:
[vc_row row_type=»row» use_row_as_full_screen_section=»no» type=»grid» angled_section=»no» text_align=»left» background_image_as_pattern=»without_pattern» z_index=»»][vc_column width=»1/2″][vc_single_image image =»15672″ img_size=»large» qode_css_animation=»»][/vc_column][vc_column width=»1/2″][vc_column_text]

Jose Ignacio Landaluce

Mayor of Algeciras for the Popular Party[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Jose Ignacio Landaluce He is the mayor of Algeciras after the 2023 Municipal Elections and candidate for Senator in the 2023 General Election. He was born on February 3, 1959.

Doctor by profession and president of the Spanish Association of Medical Centers. He completed his baccalaureate studies at the Salesianos de Algeciras school and a degree in medicine and surgery at the University of Granada.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width=»1/5″][vc_icon icon_fontawesome=»fab fa-facebook-f» color=»sky» link=»url:https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com %2Fjilandaluce%2F%3Flocale%3Des_ES|target:_blank»][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=»1/5″][vc_icon icon_fontawesome=»fab fa-instagram» color=»sky» link=»url:https% 3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram.com%2Fjilandaluce%2F%3Fhl%3Des|target:_blank»][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=»1/5″][vc_icon icon_fontawesome=»fas fa-landmark» color=» sky» link=»url:https%3A%2F%2Fwww.senado.es%2Fweb%2Fcompositionorganizacion%2Fsenadores%2Fcompositionsenado%2Ffichasenador%2Findex.html%3Fid1%3D17147%26legis%3D14|target:_blank»][/vc_column_inner] [vc_column_inner width=»1/5″][vc_icon icon_fontawesome=»fab fa-wikipedia-w» color=»sky» link=»url:https%3A%2F%2Fes.wikipedia.org%2Fwiki%2FJos%25C3% 25A9_Ignacio_Landaluce|target:_blank»][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=»1/5″][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row row_type=»row» use_row_as_full_screen_section=»no» type =»full_width» angled_section=»no» text_align=»left» background_image_as_pattern=»without_pattern»][vc_column][vc_empty_space height=»18px»][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

José Ignacio Landaluce in the act of the General Elections

[/vc_column_text][vc_video link=»https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CxuGdSY3ITI»][vc_column_text]The candidate for the Senate for the Popular Party has participated in the event held in Algeciras on the occasion of the campaign for the 2023 General Election.

José Ignacio Landaluce, praised the management of the president of the Junta de Andalucía. The mayor began by thanking the attendees for their presence, including the president. In his speech, the candidate praised the management capacity of Juanma Moreno and made reference to other political leaders present at the event, such as mayors and vice presidents, highlighting his experience and trust in them.

The emotional tone of the speech was evident when Landaluce dedicated part of his speech to Javier Muñoz, a recently deceased civil servant, and sent a message of support to his family at this difficult time. The candidate also praised the greatness of the Community of Andalusia, comparing it with Portugal and highlighted its capacity to generate tourism and economic growth.

In a more political tone, Landaluce called not to blindly believe in the polls and to vote directly for the Popular Party to achieve a sufficient majority to govern calmly and to achieve a more effective government.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/ vc_row][vc_row row_type=»row» use_row_as_full_screen_section=»no» type=»grid» angled_section=»no» text_align=»left» background_image_as_pattern=»without_pattern» z_index=»»][vc_column][vc_column_text css=».vc_custom_1678183066881{ margin-top: 18px !important;margin-bottom: 18px !important;background-color: #0bb2ff !important;}»]

Who is José Ignacio Landaluce?

[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner row_type=»row» type=»full_width» text_align=»left» css_animation=»»][vc_column_inner width=»1/2″][vc_column_text]Landaluce began his political career in 1987, as a councilor for the Algeciras City Council, becoming mayor of the city in 2011, achieving the best electoral result in the history of the Algeciras council, with 16 councillors.

In addition, he was deputy for the province of Cádiz between 2000-2004 and 2008-2015. He is First Vice President of the foreign affairs commission in the Congress of Deputies and president of the foreign affairs commission in the Senate.

Currently, he is a substitute member of the Permanent Deputation of the Senate, second secretary of the Committee on Petitions, the spokesman for the Mixed Congress-Senate Commission on relations with the Ombudsman and a member of the Mixed Commission Congress-Senate of the European Union.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=»1/2″][vc_single_image image=»15699″ img_size=»full» onclick=»custom_link» img_link_target=»_blank» qode_css_animation=»» link=»https:/ /unproyectollamadosevilla.es/»][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]

Algeciras Maritime Lake Project

On February 14, 2020, the Algeciras Bay Port Authority (APBA), the Ministry of Development, Infrastructure and Territorial Planning of the Junta de Andalucía and the Algeciras Town Hall signed a Protocol of Intentions for the joint development of the comprehensive action called Lago Marítimo, which involves the urban and environmental transformation of part of the coastal strip and the edge of the port with the city of Algeciras, and which covers the area from the bridge from the Northern Access to the southern area of ​​the Llano Amarillo.[/ Vc_column_text] [vc_column_text]

[/ Vc_column_text] [vc_column_text]The project proposes the recovery for citizen use of these spaces through their qualification, operating on them a series of improvements consisting of the implementation of the following uses:

Implementation of public uses of stay, through the urban conditioning of port spaces without commercial use.

Implementation of port logistics innovation uses, such is the case of the Port Logistics Innovation Center.

Implementation of innovative university uses, such is the case of the UCA-SEA Innovation Center or Innovation Center of the Bahía de Algeciras Campus of the University of Cádiz. These uses, in turn, will integrate and connect the northern area of ​​Llano Amarillo, which is thus positioned as a new and important university node, with the corridor that makes up the buildings and facilities that the UCA already has in the city.

Implementation of museum and exhibition uses, such is the case of the Port Museum and the Port Center or Interpretation Center of the port.

Implementation of meeting uses and citizen gathering, such is the case of the Auditorium.

Implementation of sports and recreational uses, such is the case of the spaces outside the building complex in the northern area of ​​the Llano Amarillo or the new facilities for canoeing.

Implementation of landscape and environmental uses, such is the case of the actions between the northern access bridge and the Llano Amarillo.

In short, the Lago Marítimo project involves the integration and coexistence of two autonomous realities, an active port and a living city, based on the activation of their meeting spaces through the implementation of new, innovative and sustainable public uses, reinforcing the context that both determine and share: a dynamic port city open to the future.[/ Vc_column_text] [vc_column_text]

New grassroots soccer fields

The transformation of 6 grassroots football fields in the city has brought about an exponential change in the grassroots sport of Algeciras. The installation of artificial turf in all of them demonstrates the commitment of Jose Ignacio Landaluce, and his government team, to the grassroots football clubs of Algeciras.

A modification that, in addition to promoting the best technical level of the youngsters from Algeciras, avoids many abrasions caused by falls during training sessions and matches.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width=»1/2″][vc_single_image image=»15977″ img_size=»full»][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=»1/2″][vc_single_image image=»15978 ″ img_size=»full»][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=».vc_custom_1678531833116{margin: 18px !important;padding: 18px !important;background-color: #f2f2f2 ! important;}»][vc_column][vc_column_text]

The beach in my neighborhood

The objective of the “La playa de mi barrio” project is the comprehensive, landscape and environmental regeneration of the La Concha area and its junction with San José Artesano. A work of great importance for the city will have this performance, which has a budget of more than 1,9 million euros.

It is a boost to improve the city of Algecireña, which will make the area more modern and with recreational spaces for all ages, as well as the creation of more recreational and green areas.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width=»1/2″][vc_single_image image=»15981″ img_size=»full»][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=»1/2″][vc_single_image image=»15980 ″ img_size=”full”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

political challenges

The main political challenge for the development of Algeciras, its port, and for the Community of Andalusia has been to have a quality rail network. To this end, Landaluce managed to unite, through the Central Branch Platform, more than 50 Spanish mayors in defense of the demand for infrastructure such as the Mediterranean railway corridor.

As defined by Landaluce himself, “This is a State project, an infrastructure of capital importance for the European Union and an axis that will strengthen our presence in the world; but above all it is about our neighbours, that our companies, whether small, medium or large, have the opportunity to compete under the same conditions as those of other places, taking advantage of the full potential of logistics nodes and ports. that are distributed along the corridors from north to south».[/ Vc_column_text] [vc_column_text]

Personal and family aspects of José Ignacio Landaluce

Married, with two daughters, he lives in the historic center of Algeciras. Reading and sports are his entertainment when work allows it. (Last book read Carmen Posadas small infamies, Eduardo Mendoza "Fight of cats") The book that will never forget "The Doctor" by Noah Gordon.

Conscientious and perfectionist, he fights for the interests of his citizens, always positioning himself in favor of his neighbors. Demonstrating his closeness with the citizenry, especially with the young and elderly people of the municipality, social groups that he defines as essential.

During his 12 years as mayor of Algeciras, José Ignacio Landaluce highlights the Covid-19 pandemic as the most difficult moment. When the State of Alarm was proclaimed, on March 14, 2021, he was already isolated, testing positive for the respiratory infection, which would lead him to be hospitalized for weeks.[/ Vc_column_text] [/ vc_column] [/ vc_row]
